title: Issues when reinstalling League on Patch 6.24
body: Recently, I came across a bug when queuing for ranked where I continuously got disconnected from the lobby and then from the client. I couldn't log back in for long without disconnecting and repairing didn't work so I had to reinstall. However, when I started reinstalling and the process got to 1%, a message occurred saying "There has been an unspecified error, check your logs for more information." after which it closes the program. I've attached the crash logs, and I need help with what to do next, seeing as how I could not find any solutions. Thanks in advance! https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4ZfdK3jzx37QWRkdWVEZ0VnX0U

replies.body: I don't know if it's the same issue but I keep getting bug splat every single time I try to get in game. Can't get to loading screen it brings me back to client to reconnect. :/

That was my initial Issue though It went away after trying to reconnect. Later on my client became so buggy i could not log on and not crash the client. Not sure why this happened. League has been working fine for me for over a year on my new laptop and then all of the sudden, this happens.

Bugsplats usually occur from bad drivers or game files failing to load the game, so reinstalling likely resolved that.  At 1% the patcher is trying to scan your game files to prep for updates but something is blocking it.  Go over the steps in the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to resolve that unspecified error.  I hope that helps!
